name: Nuts and Bolts of Encryption: A Primer for Policymakers.
Keys under Doormats
description: Or why cryptography shouldn't be backdoored, by a all-star committee of crypto researches from around the world.

name: An Overview of Cryptography
description: By Gary C. Kessler.

name: Using Encryption for Authentication in Large Networks
description: By Needham, Schroeder: this is were crypto-based auth starts.

name: Communication Theory of Secrecy Systems
description: Fundamental cryptography paper by Claude Shannon.

name: Another Look at “Provable Security”
description: Inquiries into formalism and naive intuition behind security proofs, by Neal Koblitz et al.

name: The security impact of a new cryptographic library
description: Introductory paper on NaCl, discussing important aspects of implementing cryptography and using it as a larger building block in security systems, by Daniel J. Bernstein, Tanja Lange, Peter Schwabe.

name: FIPS 198-1: HMACs
description: The Keyed-Hash Message Authentication Code FIPS document.

name: FIPS 202: SHA3
description: SHA-3 Standard: Permutation-Based Hash and Extendable-Output Functions.

name: Birthday problem
description: The best simple explanation of math behind birthday attack.

name: On the Security of HMAC and NMAC Based on HAVAL, MD4, MD5, SHA-0 and SHA-1
description: Security analysis of different legacy HMAC schemes by Jongsung Kim et al.

name: On the Security of Randomized CBC-MAC Beyond the Birthday Paradox Limit
description: Security of randomized CBC-MACs and a new construction that resists birthday paradox attacks and provably reaches full security, by E. Jaulmes et al.

name: FIPS 197
description: AES FIPS document.

name: List of proposed operation modes of AES
description: Maintained by NIST.

name: Recomendation for Block Cipher modes of operation: Methods and Techniques.
Stick figure guide to AES
description: If stuff above was a bit hard or you're looking for a good laugh.

name: Cache timing attacks on AES
description: Example of designing great practical attack on cipher implementation, by Daniel J. Bernstein.

name: Cache Attacks and Countermeasures: the Case of AES
description: Side channel attacks on AES, another view, by Dag Arne Osvik, Adi Shamir and Eran Tromer.

name: Salsa20 family of stream ciphers
description: Broad explanation of Salsa20 security cipher by Daniel J. Bernstein.

name: New Features of Latin Dances: Analysis of Salsa, ChaCha, and Rumba
description: Analysis of Salsa20 family of ciphers, by Jean-Philippe Aumasson et al.

name: ChaCha20-Poly1305 Cipher Suites for Transport Layer Security (TLS)
description: IETF Draft of ciphersuite family, by Adam Langley et al.

name: AES submission document on Rijndael
description: Original Rijndael proposal by Joan Daemen and Vincent Rijmen.

name: Ongoing Research Areas in Symmetric Cryptography
description: Overview of ongoing research in secret key crypto and hashes by ECRYPT Network of Excellence in Cryptology.

name: The Galois/Counter Mode of Operation (GCM)
description: Original paper introducing GCM, by by David A. McGrew and John Viega.

name: The Security and Performance of the Galois/Counter Mode (GCM) of Operation
description: Design, analysis and security of GCM, and, more specifically, AES GCM mode, by David A. McGrew and John Viega.

name: GCM Security Bounds Reconsidered
description: An analysis and algorithm for nonce generation for AES GCM with higher counter-collision probability, by Yuichi Niwa, Keisuke Ohashi, Kazuhiko Minematsu, Tetsu Iwata.

name: Proxy-Mediated Searchable Encryption in SQL Databases Using Blind Indexes
description: An overview of existing searchable encryption schemes, and analysis of scheme built on AES-GCM, blind index and bloom filter by Eugene Pilyankevich, Dmytro Kornieiev, Artem Storozhuk.

name: Differential Cryptanalysis of Salsa20/8
description: A great example of stream cipher cryptoanalysis, by Yukiyasu Tsunoo et al.

name: Slide Attacks on a Class of Hash Functions
description: Applying slide attacks (typical cryptoanalysis technique for block ciphers) to hash functions, M. Gorski et al.

name: Self-Study Course in Block Cipher Cryptanalysis
description: Attempt to organize the existing literature of block-cipher cryptanalysis in a way that students can use to learn cryptanalytic techniques and ways to break new algorithms, by Bruce Schneier.

name: Statistical Cryptanalysis of Block Ciphers
description: By Pascal Junod.

name: Cryptoanalysis of block ciphers and protocols
description: By Elad Pinhas Barkan.

name: Too much crypto
description: Analysis of number of rounds for symmetric cryptography primitives, and suggestions to do fewer rounds, by Jean-Philippe Aumasson.

name: How to Break MD5 and Other Hash Functions
description: A 2005 paper about modular differential collision attack on MD5, MD4 and other hash functions, by Xiaoyun Wang and Hongbo Yu.

name: New attacks on Keccak-224 and Keccak-256
description: A 2012 paper about using the combination of differential and algebraic techniques for collision attacks on SHA-3, by Itai Dinur, Orr Dunkelman, Adi Shamir.

name: A Single-Key Attack on the Full GOST Block Cipher
description: An attack ("Reflection-Meet-inthe-Middle Attack") on GOST block cipher that allows to recover key with 2^225 computations and 2^32 known plaintexts, by Takanori Isobe.

name: New Directions in Cryptography
description: Seminal paper by Diffie and Hellman, introducing public key cryptography and key exchange/agreement protocol.

name: RFC 2631: Diffie-Hellman Key Agreement
description: An explanation of the Diffie-Hellman methon in more engineering terms.

name: A Method for Obtaining Digital Signatures and Public-Key Cryptosystems
description: Original paper introducing RSA algorithm.

name: RSA Algorithm
description: Rather education explanation of every bit behind RSA.

name: Secure Communications Over Insecure Channels
description: Paper by R. Merkle,   predated "New directions in cryptography" though it was published after it. The Diffie-Hellman key exchange is an implementation of such a Merkle system.

name: On the Security of Public Key Protocols
description: Dolev-Yao model is a formal model, used to prove properties of interactive cryptographic protocols.

name: How to Share a Secret
description: A safe method for sharing secrets.

name: Twenty Years of Attacks on the RSA Cryptosystem
description: Great inquiry into attacking RSA and it's internals, by Dan Boneh.

name: Remote timing attacks are practical
description: An example in attacking practical crypto implementationby D. Boneh, D. Brumley.

name: The Equivalence Between the DHP and DLP for Elliptic Curves Used in Practical Applications, Revisited
description: by K. Bentahar.

name: Elliptic Curve cryptography: A gentle introduction.
Explain me like I'm 5: How digital signatures actually work
description: EdDSA explained with ease and elegance.

name: Elliptic Curve Cryptography: finite fields and discrete logarithms.
Detailed Elliptic Curve cryptography tutorial.
Elliptic Curve Cryptography: ECDH and ECDSA.
Elliptic Curve Cryptography: breaking security and a comparison with RSA.
Elliptic Curve Cryptography: the serpentine course of a paradigm shift
description: Historic inquiry into development of ECC and it's adoption.

name: Let's construct an elliptic curve: Introducing Crackpot2065
description: Fine example of building up ECC from scratch.

name: Explicit-Formulas Database
description: For many elliptic curve representation forms.

name: Curve25519: new Diffie-Hellman speed records
description: Paper on Curve25519.

name: Software implementation of the NIST elliptic curves over prime fields
description: Pracitcal example of implementing elliptic curve crypto, by M. Brown et al.

name: High-speed high-security signatures
description: Seminal paper on EdDSA signatures on ed25519 curve by Daniel J. Bernstein et al.

name: Proofs of knowledge
description: A pair of papers which investigate the notions of proof of knowledge and proof of computational ability, M. Bellare and O. Goldreich.

name: How to construct zero-knowledge proof systems for NP
description: Classic paper by Goldreich,  Micali and Wigderson.

name: Proofs that yield nothing but their validity and a Methodology of Cryptographic protocol design
description: By Goldreich,  Micali and Wigderson, a relative to the above.

name: A Survey of Noninteractive Zero Knowledge Proof System and Its Applications.
How to Prove a Theorem So No One Else Can Claim It
description: By Manuel Blum.

name: Information Theoretic Reductions among Disclosure Problems
description: Brassau et al.

name: Knowledge complexity of interactive proof systems
description: By GoldWasser, Micali and Rackoff. Defining computational complexity of "knowledge" within zero knowledge proofs.

name: A Survey of Zero-Knowledge Proofs with Applications to Cryptography
description: Great intro on original ZKP protocols.

name: Zero Knowledge Protocols and Small Systems
description: A good intro into Zero knowledge protocols.

name: Multi-Theorem Preprocessing NIZKs from Lattices
description: Construction of non-interactive zero-knowledge (NIZK) proofs using lattice-based preprocessing models, by Sam Kim and David J. Wu.

name: Recommendation for Key Management – Part 1: General
description: Methodologically very relevant document on goals and procedures of key management.

name: Selecting Cryptographic Key Sizes
description: Classic paper from 1999 with guidelines for the determination of key sizes for symmetric cryptosystems, RSA, ECC, by Arjen K. Lenstra and Eric R. Verheul.

name: PRIMES is in P
description: Unconditional deterministic polynomial-time algorithm that determines whether an input number is prime or composite.

name: Post-quantum cryptography
description: dealing with the fallout of physics success - Brief observation of mathematical tasks that can be used to build cryptosystems secure against attacks by post-quantum computers.

name: Post-quantum cryptography
description: Introduction to post-quantum cryptography.

name: Post-quantum RSA
description: Daniel Bernshtein's insight how to save RSA in post-quantum period.

name: A Graduate Course in Applied Cryptography
description: By Dan Boneh and Victor Shoup. A well-balanced introductory course into cryptography, a bit of cryptoanalysis and cryptography-related security.

name: Analysis and design of cryptographic hash functions, MAC algorithms and block ciphers
description: Broad overview of design and cryptoanalysis of various ciphers and hash functions, by Bart Van Rompay.

name: CrypTool book
description: Predominantly mathematically oriented information on learning, using and experimenting cryptographic procedures.

name: Handbook of Applied Cryptography
description: By Alfred J. Menezes, Paul C. van Oorschot and Scott A. Vanstone. Good classical introduction into cryptography and ciphers.

name: The joy of Cryptography
description: By Mike Rosulek. A lot of basic stuff covered really well. No ECC.

name: A Computational Introduction to Number Theory and Algebra
description: By Victor Shoup, excellent starters book on math universally used in cryptography.

name: Understanding cryptography: A textbook for Students and Practitioners
description: Textbook, great lectures and problems to solve.

name: Crypto101
description: Crypto 101 is an introductory course on cryptography, freely available for programmers of all ages and skill levels.

name: A Course in Cryptography
description: Lecture notes by Rafael Pass, Abhi Shelat.

name: Lecture Notes on Cryptography
description: Famous set of lectures on cryptography by Shafi Goldwasser (MIT), M. Bellare (University of California).

name: Introduction to Cryptography by Christof Paar
description: Video course by Christof Paar (University of Bochum in Germany). In english.

name: Cryptography I
description: Stanford University course on Coursera, taught by prof. Dan Boneh. Cryptography II is still in development.
